intro: Serrafalcus arvensis proles duvalii, commonly known as the Duval's field serrafalcus, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties. The plant features narrow, serrated leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or along riverbanks. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
